title: Man fighting for life after trying to scale building like Spiderman after girlfriend locked him out
text:
A man is fighting for life after trying to scale down a building to get into his apartment.

The 29-year-old man used a rope to abseil down from the roof of the building, in Whitmore Square, in Adelaide's CBD, at 5am on Monday morning.

He had been locked out of his Hocking Place apartment after following a row with his girlfriend.

According to South Australia Police, the cable snapped as the man approached the third floor balcony.

A man is fighting for his life after he fell from a third floor balcony as he was trying to scale a building to get into his apartment after his girlfriend locked him out

He then fell 10m to the ground, landing on concrete and knocking himself unconscious.

Emergency services were called about 5.15am where they found the man lying in a pool of blood.

The man was rushed to the Royal Adelaide Hospital with serious, life-threatening injuries.

Police believe the incident was a case of 'misadventure', The Advertiser reported.

Another man was treated by paramedics for minor injuries after falling inside the building from a landing in the stairwell.
